meaningMnemonic: Killing two <radical>tree</radical>s with a <radical>jackhammer</radical> is expressly <kanji>prohibit</kanji>ed. Don't get me wrong, you can rip up one tree with your jackhammer, but not two.
readingMnemonic: The person who decided to <kanji>prohibit</kanji> jackhammering two trees is the <reading>Kin</reading>g (きん) of England. He's the only person who's able to prohibit certain things, so it had to be him.
